website_summaries.verdict: This officially licensed charging station and 1,200 mAh battery pack combo is the best option to keep your controllers going for the next game.
pros: The battery packs replace your batteries, allowing you to set up to 2 controllers on the docking station
Charge lasts for up to 35 hrs
Battery packs fully charge in a couple hours, and green LEDs indicate when they're fully charged
The charging station is sleek and has a small footprint
cons: Some customers have issues connecting controllers to the dock

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rechargable docking station for XBOX One controllers
customer_reviews.text: This charging station looks great! It holds two XBOX one controllers. It comes with 2 rechargable battery packs and 2 new battery covers for the controller. You will need to swap out the current battery and battery cover on your remote with the provided ones. It's very easy to place the remotes on the station. Due to the 45 degree angle, sometimes, if you are careless and don't place it right, the remote will slide down and fall so make sure you don't place this somewhere high as the remote may take a big drop. The remotes look really nice while they are charging as well.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: Does not last!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this charger at first, but after 2 months it has become insanely frustrating to charge my controllers. Initially I thought the surface I placed the charge on was uneven and thats why the red light would flicker but after moving it I realized that wasn’t the issue. I noticed that there are black marks that look like small burns on the battery packs and when the base came in contact with these marks it wouldn’t charge at all. I’ve gone back to AA batteries while I get an original xbox battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Only one battery works
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be great to have for my xbox one controllers, was fine out of the box but once I hooked it up I noticed one of the lights was red. Did some research and found out it wasn't charging so one battery worked and the other didn't. I can't get a replacement battery because they aren't sold separately. All I can do is buy a whole new charger and hope that at least one of the batteries works or just use the current one I have with the one good battery....
customer_reviews.author: Ravyn Rankin

customer_reviews.title: 5 Years In!
customer_reviews.text: It's currently September of 2018, and I have had this deployed daily since December of 2013. That's amazing. I will say that some little bumps can disrupt the charging, but the lights help clue you into that. (The build has changed since I bought it, but this is still the same product page and company, so I would be inclined to trust their updates to the item as well). Highly recommended! I only bought one station since I usually don't play with all the controllers I own, and that has been working just fine for my play style.
customer_reviews.author: DJ OK Potato

customer_reviews.title: Works great at first... then flashing red!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected more out of the Energizer name. While the batteries seem fine we are seeing the same thing many other reviews note after a few months... the charging light flashes red. Since this is for my 8yo there is little chance of him finessing the position to get it right so I guess this is destined for the trash. I would not recommend buying this for a kid and even adults will be frustrated spending 5 min to get it positioned just right. So maybe everyone should skip this.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lepse

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Old plug and play kit was dying needed new one I liked this because it comes with two battery packs. great price some people said it was hard to get the controllers to charge haven't had a problem. On thing I did notice was the battery life was less than my old pack the controllers probably go about a week for me between charges but I just rotate controllers and it's better than before. Materials aren't amazing but taking price into consideration this thing is awesome. Also love the way it looks great stand for controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Works but bottom light status indicator gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: Works and chargers my controller no problem. I gave it 4 out of 5 is due to the lower charging spot having the light stuck on green. The top spot does what it's suppose to. When I place a controller that needs charging, the light indicator turns red and once it's fully charged turns green. I take it off and the light goes away. The bottom spot however, once my controller fully charged, the light stayed green the whole time and the only way to fix it is if I unplug it. It still charges the controller but it's a bit inconvenient not knowing the status of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Moulton

customer_reviews.title: One Battery Didn't Work Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: One of the batteries was dead right out of the box and won't charge. Tried in multiple controllers and on both parts of the charging station, each time getting the same blinking red light. The 2nd charger worked fine. I have multiple chargers, since my kids all have to have their own color controller, and the other ones (Nyko I think) didn't have this type of problem. I would recommend skipping the Energizer brand and looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and keeps controllers neat and off the couch / ground
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect to get the great performance we've received. We have an XBox One and three kids who play it pretty frequently. The charger has worked well for over two years, as long as they remember to put the controllers back on the charger. This is actually a great trick since it keeps them from leaving stuff lying around-- you need to put the controller away! It charges quickly, holds a charge plenty adequate for a non-marathon gaming session, and has been almost no trouble at all. It even looks good. My one gripe is that now after two years you often have to jiggle the controller to get a good connection-- otherwise the charge doesn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take up much space and doesn't look gaudy. Or charges effectively, and is very easy to use. This unit is a contact based charger, without USB ports. Chargers with USB ports require you to be careful with, and watch how you plug it in and go against USB port resistance. This can be a pain, especially when you're just trying to plug it in quickly and get going. THIS unit, after putting the special battery in, you just lay the controller on the charger. Red light = charging, green light = charged. Too easy, soldier!
customer_reviews.author: Veizour

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery pack
customer_reviews.text: I received the item and immediately noticed that one of the battery packs was faulty. In the package, there is a manual that states to not return to store and to contact PDP directly for any problems with the product because they'll cover 1 year limited warranty on manufacturing defects. I did, I contacted their customer service. I received an email stating they received my request and need a a few business days. No response came. I submitted another request and receive the same auto response stating they need a few business days to respond. No response came. By that time, I passed the 30 day return window on Amazon so I couldn't return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen

customer_reviews.title: Batteries great, dock is having minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for several months, but as of lately has been having a few issues with reading the battery right. If it's slightly moved the dock will stop charging the battery, but moving it a bit will get it back on track. Another thing is not connecting properly when being placed on it. Sometimes I have to move it a bit more to get it to pick it up for charging, but aside from that it's fine. I'd still say it's worth the purchase and have two as of currently.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Fast charge
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this charger stand. It is small enough to stay out of the way, fast enough to charge one or two wireless controllers in a relatively short amount of time, and does its job well. However, I would suggest that they consider adding a slightly longer power cord to it, as it barely reaches the second shelf of our TV console. There is no way it would reach a floating TV shelf or something similar. It also collects a lot of dust and is difficult to clean each week. However, these are minor complaints compared to its performance. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy in Mo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Don't let your ungrateful brother in law tell you otherwise. This spoiled little millennial thought it was a good idea to criticize this product when I gifted it to him for christmas a couple years ago. Well, he still uses it and seems to be happy we it even though he doesn't say it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe

customer_reviews.title: FIRE HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: Caution... FIRE HAZARD. After 2+ years of working fine, the controller started smoking while sitting in the charger. The battery was burning hot, probably about to ignite. It melted the inside of my Xbox controller along with the battery.
customer_reviews.author: F. Madeira

customer_reviews.title: Sub par
customer_reviews.text: One of the two batteries is complete garbage. It only holds approx a 1hr charge while gaming before it dies. When you put it on the charger it only takes 20 minutes to charge to "green" status, which means the battery life is damaged and it isn't holding a full charge. The other battery is great. Holds about 6hrs of gaming charge. Once the controllers are done charging on the station, they turn green, but keep charging until you remove them from the charging station, which if left for a long period of time will damage the battery life. I will be buying rechargeable batteries from another company next time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Owned Two, Both Quit Working.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these. The longest lasting one worked for 2 years before the flashing red light of death. The most recent one only lasted 3 months before one, then both charging ports quit working. The batteries are great and last a long time but I'm about to spend money on a a third charging station in about 2.5 years. Needless to say, it will not be this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Both my husband and I game nightly and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Both my husband and I game nightly and I was getting sick and tired of the monthly battery buys. Problem solved, I even purchased a play & charge just in case one of our battery packs died mid-game, and we've only used it once, and only because we forgot to charge a controller over night. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Must have for serious gamer
customer_reviews.text: Great product and the real McCoy not a cheap knock off or close reproduction either! This is my second one and only bought a second because I bought a two more controllers and needed another base! My first one I have used for 4 years now and could not be happier! Pay the money now cuz after ordering various "official" and/or "Microsoft" certified charging cables only to get knock offs, clones and reproductions wnd ripped off having to ship them back after they break after a week and in one case 8 hours! Buy this product it is long lasting and best value out there
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade to throwing away batteries
customer_reviews.text: I was buying AA batteries left and right for Xbox controllers. Now with this set, those days are over. Just easily set the controller on the charger when you're finished playing and it is ready to go when you're ready to play again. There is a separate charging status light for each controller. Red means it is charging and green means it is completely charged. So no guessing. And it is made by Energizer, so you know it is of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PDP Energizer Xbox One controller charger and rechargeable batteries for my boyfriend who had been going through a million AA batteries for his controllers and he has loved it so far! I like that it came with both white and black as he has one controller of each color. The batteries hold a charge for multiple lengthy gaming sessions with no problem. Previous reviews mentioned having trouble with the positioning of the controller on the dock but we haven’t had any problems with that - and the lights on the bottom let you know that it is docked and charging.
customer_reviews.author: Chad T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent charger stand
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these charging stands thus far and they're fantastic. PROS: 1) Comes with 2 battery packs as well as back plate adapters to allow for charging (2 in white, 2 in black) 2) The charge lasts FOREVER. It's fantastic. I played for probably 10hrs one day and 5hrs the next on a single charge before having to recharge (and it was still going!) 3) Love the way it displays your controllers. 4) The charge indicator lights are great as well! 5) Sturdy design feels high quality. CONS: Can't think of any! These are simply great.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: RUINED 2 of our controllers
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. Great concept to reduce the environmental impact of standard batteries. These RUINED two of our Xbox controllers ($60 each). They spazz out and select things even when the user is not holding them. I'll stick to xbox brand of rechargeable batteries for my controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was tired of buying batteries by the dozen at the stores for the remotes. I figured, worse case I continue to buy batteries. Every once in a while, I would find other remotes missing batteries because the kids steal batteries for their Xbox 1 remotes. No more worries! What a breath of fresh air. These rechargeable have saved my life. Kids blow through the batteries, place them to charge every night and I don't hear complaints that there are no more batteries! The LED shows when charged and when they are charging in a very cool way. I would highly recommend buying this if you are in the market to stop buying unnecessary batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Parkland_C6

customer_reviews.title: Battery replacement only sold at PDP website
customer_reviews.text: It works great when the battery functions. After a year of owning it, one of the batteries no longer works. I searched amazon to find a replacement battery but no one sells it by itself. You can only find it at the PDP website. It’s $5.99 and looks like free ground shipping. Kind of a waste if I bought another rechargeable unit just for a battery. I guess i’ll Have to order from PDP themselves.
customer_reviews.author: sherwinm

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have waited to review this product because of the negative reviews I have read. A lot of previous customers complained of difficult to mount controls, and an extremely short lifespan. I have had neither of these issues. The charging mount is extremely easy to use, and my controllers have charged 100% of the time. As of last night this item continues to function as promised. I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Freewynd

customer_reviews.title: Batteries not included...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grand kids for Christmas because we go through "grosses" of batteries a year on the video game controllers. The unit was easy to set two. *Comes with two rechargeable batteries that charge in about 2 hours and hold a charge for several days *The controllers stack so they are easy to see and access. You do not have to remove the batteries to charge *There are 2 green lights in the front that tell you when they EACH are charged All in all the $13.00 purchase price was insane (special buy). I later bought a second for for $29.99 for them to take to their house. This saves me about $100 a year in AAAs.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Saint

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, works as expected. No manual.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with a manual. I emailed the company and got a response that they were looking into it and would follow up with the requested information, that was a month ago. Outside of that the product works fine, batteries have a good life once charged. At low battery takes maybe an hour or two to recharge just don't know if you can leave them on the cradle or not once charging is complete. It would be nice if that were the case, but I don't believe it is.
customer_reviews.author: A-A-Ron

customer_reviews.title: One of the best charging stations I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I've got 2 of these now and I love them. I use one with my Xbox One Elite controller and one with my regular Xbox One controller. They charge pretty fast, they have LED light bars on the bottom to show when its charging and when charged. The batteries also last a lot longer than others I've used. I highly recommend getting this over others. It's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Kids like it
customer_reviews.text: This works great at saving some money on batteries and it has already paid for itself at this point. Sometimes you have to jiggle the controller around sometimes to get it to actually charge and its easy to touch and get it to go off the charger just enough that it wont charge. Still worth the money if youre tired of spending lots of money on regular batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Camper513

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one good, one not so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the first one of these and it seemed to work well. The charger vanished from here for a while and when it finally came back I bought another. With the second one, the controllers will not seat properly to charge. You have to fiddle with the controller until you see the charge light on the charger come on, then walk away easily and hope it stays connected until fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Blues

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Xbox One controllers. Holds them solidly and doesn't drop them when bumped slightly. Fast charge with GREAT, strong, long lasting batteries. I have used several different controllers with this (to test it) and all have worked for 2-3 days (of holiday weekend gaming - so more than a few hours a day) without needing to be charged! The batteries last much longer than a cheap rechargeable set (Microsoft play and charge replica) I bought on an auction site. The only watchout is that the power cord is a little shorter than I would have liked (about 2-3 ft).
customer_reviews.author: UMS

customer_reviews.title: This is horrible. Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible. Worst product ever! My controller disconnects every 30 seconds even when the batteries are on full charge. This is the absolute worst ever! I'd rather buy single AA batteries than this. Imagine playing multiplayer and all of a sudden your controller disconnects because of these batteries. It ruins your experience. Stay away from these things. It's just a paper weight now and I can't even return it!
customer_reviews.author: FootyStallion

customer_reviews.title: Functioned well for about 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this charging station since December 2015, and I'm starting to have trouble with the controllers not charging or connecting to my xbox1. Makes me frustrated because this system has been awesome up until now. I've always had to pay attention to make sure the controllers are connecting to the base to charge, but now even though it still turns green when it's supposedly "fully charged" the lack of connectivity of the controller to the xbox proves otherwise. I'm not sure how long the warranty is for this but if it's 1 year and a few months then there ya go, that's about how long this system lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Lori0104

customer_reviews.title: easy to place remotes and remove them
customer_reviews.text: Very elegant design, easy to place remotes and remove them. However, you may have to manipulate placement of remote a little to get the charging LED to activate. Works as described, bargain since it comes with rechargeable battery packs. Does not affect weight on controller. Will comment again once I test battery life, (or maybe not since when I am done playing I will likely place it back in the charger). Update: Been using this product for a while now. Extremely happy with this purchase, likely the best charging system out there. Battery life is comparable to batteries and other charging systems but if you place them in holder when you are done playing, you will never run low.
customer_reviews.author: Nadir Bhuiyan M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy wireless charging
customer_reviews.text: Just remove your old batteries from your controllers, put these in, snap on the battery covers that come with these, plug the charger stand in, then slide the controllers into the two slots. The weight of the controllers holds the charge surface where it needs to be and alight indicates that it's properly seated. After that initial setup just slide the controllers into the slots to charge. Very easy. Charges quickly, holds charge for more than 12 continuous hours of play. I'm very pleased with this product. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: Fails quickly
customer_reviews.text: This thing only lasted about 2 months. The top light stayed red whether or not something was charging and the bottom charger stopped working altogether. Also, it is somewhat difficult to get the controllers to sit correctly in the base. The slightest tap will make them stop charging. Additionally, it seems like the charger never stops trying to charge even when charging is done and light flips to green. This seems to ruin the battery over time.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M

customer_reviews.title: Constantly disconnects.
customer_reviews.text: After about a month, they stopped connecting. I have to jiggle and play with it for a few minutes to get the controller to start charging. If it gets slightly bumped, I gotta play with it again. This is a design flaw. But it can be tolerated. Otherwise it works just fine - I just wish you could buy extra batteries without purchasing a second charging deck - since we have only three controllers. If I had to purchase it again, I'd get a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works great, the price is totally worth it especially if you play a lot.
customer_reviews.text: This charging station works great for my xbox one controls. I love that it has led lights to show me if they are fully charged or not and replacing the battery pack and controller back was a snap. It doesnt change how the control feels in your hand either and make playing a breeze without the annoying warning that your controller batteries are low or even worse the control dying on you just before you were about to get play of the game in overwatch. I really like this system and the stand sits pretty low and can fit right on top of the xbox in my stand for the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Mia

customer_reviews.title: Quick charge, long play time
customer_reviews.text: Love this charger. Replaced an old Nyko charger. The dual controller feature was a necessity. The controllers “lock” in place way better than other chargers. The stacked design makes for easy controller access. Haven’t used for a long time so can’t speak to how the batteries hold up long term but have been very happy with the several hours of gameplay we get out of one charge. The red and green charge lights are simple and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: BENJAMIN ANDREWS

customer_reviews.title: Updated: DEAD OUT OF BOX
customer_reviews.text: I was issued a replacement and all is well! Not much of a hassle other than going to the post office to drop off package. DOA, I really thought being a licensed product that it would have at least worked for a short while. the batteries came charged and worked until the wore down, can't even charge them via front controller port..... i may have been able to over look the faulty dock if i had been able to at least charge them that way. plus the item is not what is pictured, what i received was a tri pod looking one that the controllers have a hard time staying in place. will not purchase again from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy not Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I got the older version and after just one month, each time I have to play with charger and move the controller around to get the light on. Honestly I didn't mind to do that, but now I have make the connection part wet and move the controller like a min for each one to get it to work.I think this new version is more Sturdy and it's not Flimsy like the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Magix

customer_reviews.title: Its a quality lottery. Mine lasted 2 months before giving up the ghost.
customer_reviews.text: Only worked 3 months before the charger went haywire. But the charger sat in a box for a month. So a total of 2 months use. Charger just flashes red. Seems like something is wrong, so I checked all the connections and switched the controllers to have the same issue. Blinks red whether or not the controller is on the charger. Would rather pay double for a high quality item than have to replace this four times a year. But looking at the review history, it looks like the item is hit or miss. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, must buy
customer_reviews.text: This charger is fantastic! Not only does it charge (no overcharging) your controller without having to plug in a cord; it offers you controller a designated home. I am very happy with this charger and highly recommend it to any Xbox owner with two controllers. I was able to swap out controllers as I depleted the charge. No gaming downtime!
customer_reviews.author: Jax B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our oldest son for his Xbox one and it makes perfect. It came with two different backs to it one set white and the other is a white set which is great because not everyone has the same black or white controlled and some people have one black and one white controller. It definitely beats buying batteries all the time because they were getting extremely expensive. We love it and so is our son. Great Christmas gift!!
customer_reviews.author: Shantel Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Saves Me Tons Of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: This licensed charger will charge 2 controllers and includes the rechargeable battery packs as well. Energizer makes a great product, Everyone with an Xbox I know of has this charger set and some are over a year old already and still like new. This charger pays for itself very quickly if you actually use your Xbox. Nice bright green glow when fully charged and a nice bright red glow when it is actively charging the controller. This is a must have for any gamer and it makes for hassle-free battery tending. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently purchased wireless controllers so it obviously was a must have to purchase this rechargeable battery pack stand. This stand is able to charge 2 controllers at once. Comes with rechargeable batteries. Lights on stand let you know the controllers are charging and when they are done. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Wiest

customer_reviews.title: Works But No 35 Hours of Gameplay
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never got anywhere to 35 hours of gameplay after charging, maybe 6-8 hours at most. When placing controllers on charging base they’ve got to be placed perfectly or else the light on the base will blink rapidly & gets aggravating at times. Sometimes it won’t let you know it’s not charging correctly until you‘ve already flopped back down in your beanbag chair & with your hand in the Dorito bag...super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: CT2012

customer_reviews.title: My control will lose connection during game play and whenever it feels like it. I didn't have this problem before with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this 3 stars because of the issue I experienced soon after installing the battery. My control will lose connection during game play and whenever it feels like it. I didn't have this problem before with regular batteries so I figured I'd test it week over week. With the rechargeable batteries... it dropped at least 3-4 times a day. With regular batteries absolutely zero times. So if you don't mind losing connection here and there... then by all means buy it. I'm just gonna suck it up and hold onto them.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Infante

customer_reviews.title: Still works great after over 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now and its still holding up great! The battery life is good, hasn't been dying down slowly. Probably has a bit less use time than regular batteries but that's always the case with rechargeables. I don't play every day so I'm not a heavy gamer. But I've played enough to put each battery through at least 50 charge cycles. I run the batteries low before recharging them. So I don't have the controller docked unless it needs to charge. Helps increase the life of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Hooray for wireless!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving these for my xbox one controllers. The stand looks cool, and being completely wireless (except for the power plug) is totally sweet as I hate wires and cords. I can deal with zip tieing the power cord, it's behind my entertainment center anyway. The bottom spot seems to charge slower than the top, but still charged both controllers. I like that they even put enough thought into the product to send 2 different color backings, 2 white and 2 black.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Roatch

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Controllers just rest on the stand and only takes a few hours to fully charge both controllers. Lightweight, small to fit anywhere, which is nice for people who live in small apartments with limited space, and haven't had one problem with it since I got it during Christmas time. As an added bonus my boyfriend loved that they came with extra battery packs for he almost went out and bought some more before this arrived in the mail. Perfect timing!
customer_reviews.author: Rae1738

customer_reviews.title: Hate the plug, love the rest.
customer_reviews.text: I have one quibble with these and that is the plug into the wall. With my power strip it blocks an adjacent plug. Other than that I am satisfied. The battery packs last a good length of time, the light indicators for charge are useful, and it doesn't take up too much space. I don't game heavily so they last a couple weeks per charge. I do wish I could buy a second set of batteries+controller backs only that would be compatible with XBOX360 so I could charge both sets of controllers on the same base (it is a good sign that I would want to do that).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brady

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of the Chargers and the fact it comes with 2 white and black battery covers for your remotes. The rechargeable batteries look to be individual rechargeable AAs in a case so if they go bad over time you can order just The batteries. I will confirm. The only thing I don't like is the plastic feels cheap and it's extremely light weight. We'll see how long these last
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient charger with just some minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very happy with this charger. I've had it for over a month now with many hours of use and the batteries seem to hold a charge without issue. The main issue I have with the charger stand is that you have to place the controller very precisely on the stand. The front indicator lights do help a ton, but I had a few times where I came back and noticed the controller wasn't sitting on the charger just right so it never charged.
customer_reviews.author: Xamul Vang

customer_reviews.title: Works well, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Charges my xbox one controllers very well. Easy to use... the hardest part was getting the batteries into the controllers with the cover. Once in tho they work very well and hold a charge for a while!
customer_reviews.author: E H

customer_reviews.title: Green means GO!
customer_reviews.text: This stand looks great, and works well. I haven't tested "battery life", but installation was super smooth. It comes with the two battery packs AND two covers. I didn't notice them first, and was super confused when the old backs would fit right. Don't make that mistake, haha! You do NOT need to snap them apart or anything to charge them. The included backs have holes cut out where the battery can touch the charger. This doesn't impede the controller at all, didn't make it noticeably heavier/lighter, etc. Definitely suggest this!
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This is so cheap and flimsy, I’m surprised a company like energizer would put their brand name on it, and that Xbox too. The controls just barely stay on, and if you pump it they fall right off. So far, the battery life has been okay. I’m guessing the batteries are the only part made by energizer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Charges good, but finicky
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works well. The problem is that the controllers have to sit in there exactly right to charge and I thought having it kind of stand up would be a nice space saver, but it's kind of top heavy so it falls over kind of easy if you bump it or try to put the controller in it sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Brixton Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Energizer product
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about getting a non-Microsoft battery charger. I became even more nervous when I saw how flimsy the stand appeared to be. But it functions as-advertised, and my clumsiness has yet to put a scratch in it. The Energizer name across the top comforted me before I started charging. One note, the package I received didn't come with any instructions. The replacement backing for your controller is pretty self-explanatory, and once I figured out that I had the battery pack in upside down, I was good. Hint - there needs to be metal-on-metal contact to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wolf

customer_reviews.title: It worked when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Like the title said, it worked when it worked.. I bought it in June but by September I noticed that the charge lights were no longer coming on when I replaced the controllers to the dock. The AD adapter went bad on it. I thought I was buying the 'good one' by getting the Energizer brand but turns out it's junk like many of the others, just more expensive. As luck would have it, I had a 5v adapter from some long forgotten device that fit the unit and it is now working again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but......Caution
customer_reviews.text: So this is a good product and well made. However unlick the previous model that loads and rests the controller from the top, this one mounts at the bottom. This is not necessarily an issue unless you have an audio adapter, like the kind from Turtle Beach, attached to the bottom of the controller. The upside is that the battery packs that come with the new model are the same as the old one, so I just swapped out my dead batteries and continue to use my original charging station.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, see comment on maintenance..
customer_reviews.text: 2nd purchase of this item. The first one lasted about 2 years before it started not charging consistently. When you set the controller on the base, the light would either not turn on or would strobe. Realized the controllers were not charging. Wasn't sure if it was the base on the battery packs, so elected to buy another one. After setting up the second one, I took sandpaper to the contacts on the battery packs and looks like it's working now. So, may just need to clean/scrape off the contacts periodically to ensure it remains functional. Worked great for the 2 years prior to needing to do that little maintenance. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Must have upgrade for old pdp Xbox users
customer_reviews.text: I have in the past used the original pdp Xbox controller chargers with the plastic clip design. After years of struggling with the controllers and the stand and attempting to make it make proper contact with the charging pins I felt it was a time for a upgrade. I was quite sceptical about the new design, but the amazing customer service definitely convinced me to give them another try. And oh boy was I not disappointed. The new design corrects the massive design flaws from the past. It's compatible with both the regular and elite controllers and charges them pretty fast as well. Hands down a amazing charger that is extremely reliable. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Prosenjit

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for a pair of standard Xbox One controllers. Works great, no issues so far. I picked up an Elite controller down the line and got a second one of these for it. The battery cover for the second set has outer prongs on it so it would only fit standard controllers, unless you cut them off of course. However, the first set I bought only have the middle tong so the cover works fine with an Elite controller. Same product, bought months apart, received two different sets of battery covers, one that works in an Elite controller without modifiying it and one that does not. Lame redesign attempt to thwart using these on Elite controllers? Why?!?
customer_reviews.author: ceestep

customer_reviews.title: these thing is awesome. Also when the controllers are on the dock ...
customer_reviews.text: I have another charger but after 3-4 hours the batteries go dead. Ive played close to 8 hours so far on one charge and I still have over half a battery. these thing is awesome. Also when the controllers are on the dock it feels secure. Some docks like this the controller feels real loose and makes your question if you have good connection. Don't have doubt, buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Cory C.

customer_reviews.title: this is good quality charger
customer_reviews.text: this is good quality charger, i recommend it, i never have problem with it i notice some people have over heat because the battery was not installed correctly if you have issue like that just take the battery out and put it back in correctly i had this issue that is why i am sharing my experience
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Energizer got it right
customer_reviews.text: Energizer got this set up right. I really enjoy not having to have it connected to my stem. The batteries last all day and recharge quickly. The only hindrance is that sometimes the controller will not connect all the way with the charging mechanism. Make sure your indicator light on the charger is on. Other than that, I think this is a great set up.
customer_reviews.author: LookHowCreative

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for ~4 years and it's still kickin!
customer_reviews.text: I love this charger. I'm a casual gamer and don't give this guy too much of a workout, but I'm not lying when I say I've had it for about 4 years, it still works as great as when it was first purchased. This charger is WELL worth the money. That's it and that's all.
customer_reviews.author: BlankShore

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had other charging stations in the past and this one is the best so far! others the contacts don't line up and you have to play with the station to get it to charge or the station breaks after a few months. this one works well. contacts line up very easy. plop controlled on and its charging.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It’s better than buying batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This was an ok buy. The battery life is pretty weak to be honest. I always have to charge them and they take a long time to charge. I would recommend getting the Microsoft rechargeable battery pack as they are the best I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Sweet

customer_reviews.title: No more plugging in controller, quick to charge between gaming sessions
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years this baby is still going strong. The batter packs come with a special battery door for the controller. This has an open spot that allows the batter to make contact with the charger. That way when you can just dock the controller and not have to plug anything in. I gave it 4 stars because they contact points could be designed better. You have to line up the controller to the docking station and sometimes it takes a few tries. A little will turn on when the connection has been made.
customer_reviews.author: Only place I shop

customer_reviews.title: I originally got this around christmas and it worked fine. About 20 days later the bottom charger would ...
customer_reviews.text: We'll see how it goes. I originally got this around christmas and it worked fine. About 20 days later the bottom charger would no longer charge but the top worked fine. Tried switching the controllers, the batteries, unplugging and replugging, reseating the controllers and nothing worked it would just flash red anything a controller was on it but the top would work. Finally contacted Amazon and they sent another and since then its worked fine but I am still nervous it may repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Holds a charge for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: At first i was unsure of the battery life of rechargeable batteries, but this set has shown me the benefits of going rechargeable. It charges the batteries fast and the controller holds the charge for days (depending on gameplay). Super convenient and easy to setup and use. I definitely recommend this product to gamers of all levels and uses.
customer_reviews.author: KeziaPurrsTop Contributor: Violins

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a month
customer_reviews.text: Got this thing for christmas, worked fine for a little over a month and then the bottom charger port broke and won't charge the batteries. It always has a constant red light on like it's charging something even when a controller isn't in it, only the top port works now but that might break soon who knows. This product IS NOT reliable
customer_reviews.author: Will Heydari

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I was a big skeptical when I first bought one of these two years ago when I first got my Xbox One because it was a 3rd party product (Energizer and not Microsoft) because we always only used the Microsoft batteries and chargers in our Xbox 360 previously. But two years later the stand and batteries are alive and kicking with zero problems... and I can't say the same for both of my original Xbox One controllers as I've had to replace one already. So this year I'm buying a pair of new themed controllers and a second Energizer charging stand to go with it so we'll have a full set of four controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great charger, but not able to buy extra batteries
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I had 2 controllers, works great for that. I had expected to be able to get additional batteries when I got more controllers, but after searching high and low, I was not able to find them sold seperately. I expected more from Energizer.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: I like this one more than the flat Nyko one
customer_reviews.text: I like this one more than the flat Nyko one, but mostly because it glows. The battery life of the included batteries is fantastic. I'll play for three to four days before needing to recharge them. The ONLY downside is that while you can plug and play with a micro-USB cable, it will not charge the controllers. Any wall charger you have that's micro-USB will allow you to play if you don't have time to charge the controller, so you're not stuck three feet from the TV screen or anything.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included
customer_reviews.text: The charger does what it's supposed to do, but the package contents don't include any instructions. I consider myself to be fairly intelligent, but I had a difficult time getting it working until I saw an instructional video on YouTube. I bought the charger during an incredible Black Friday sale, so I guess I shouldn't complain, but a simple pamphlet with setup instructions would've earned 5 stars instead of the 4 I'm giving.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Herring

customer_reviews.title: Works but replacement back cover don’t fit
customer_reviews.text: Works great but Energizer covers don’t fit backs of the four controllers we have. They are all a little different and purchased in different years but they don’t fit any of them. It’s not a big deal and it doesn’t bother the kids or functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Rosamilia

customer_reviews.title: Connector problems, flashing red light.
customer_reviews.text: It took just about 45 days to start showing weird problems. Product looks cheap but was working fine for the first month. Now every time I sit the controllers, the red light flashes endlessly without charging them. I found that if I take the battery cover off and try to charge it 'naked', it eventually work. I'm doing a formal complaint for Energizer in hope that there's a fix for it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Saldanha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Love that it has the black and white back options to match most controllers. Easy to use! Perfect gift for the gamers! And no more listening to the "my batteries are dead, I need new ones, hurry up" because you just set it on the stand and grab the second one!
customer_reviews.author: KailaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best Charger for Xbox One Controllers Out There!
customer_reviews.text: Great little charging station. I bought one for my father last year. He uses it all the time. I finally bought one myself and it works great. Easy to see the charging indicators for the batteries when charging. Doesn't look like a cheap product. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parduhn

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! The stand makes it easy to both place and retrieve a controller while another is still on the charger. The battery packs hold a charge for a good amount of time and charge fairly quickly. I enjoy the fact it includes two white and black battery covers, as I had one white controller that was stuck with a black backing from my old charging stand. I may have to purchase another in the future, as I have a controller collection.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: and the charge holds for a good amount of time
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this charger for a few months now and have not experienced any problems. We don’t have to charge the batteries all that often, and the charge holds for a good amount of time. My only complaint is that I purchased two additional controllers recently but couldn’t find an option to purchase just the rechargeable battery packs. I had to purchase a whole new charging set when I only needed the battery packs. The second charger is taking up space in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: belliott

customer_reviews.title: Barely hold charge after one month of use
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry to report that after a month of using these battery packs, they have proven to be a disappointment. They take a considerable amount of time to recharge and only hold up for about an hour of continual use. Not sure if they are old units with degraded capacity or what.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Doss

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while, but...
customer_reviews.text: it is starting to not work after a year's use. It worked brilliantly (bought two, I have four controllers), but now both of them have started to suffer from a flashing red light and it hardly charges the controllers anymore. At first it was really finnicky and I'd need to slightly change the angle at which I placed the controller for it to charge, but now it is becoming unusable. Again it worked perfectly for about a year... sad to see these guys die so soon, I really liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Sgro

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. It only took a few minutes to set up, which was pretty straight forward. I timed how long it would take for the charge pack it came with to turn "green" on the pedestal.... just over 3 hours. I figured that was pretty reasonable. I assume it continually charges considering its connected to a power source, so I have not been leaving my controllers charging, rather I only place them to charge after a few hours of gaming. I have not timed how long it takes for the charge pack to die, so time will tell... Cheaper than buying a bunch of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Battery pack won't hold charge
customer_reviews.text: I received this item yesterday after our previous energizer system stopped holding a charge. I docked both controllers, went to bed, and awoke to one pack being completely dead. It was properly docked, the base showed a green light like it was charged, but it was unable to power the controller. We already tossed out the old dock and batteries, so we have no feasible way to charge both controllers. This is incredibly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: m.gizewski

customer_reviews.title: Never fear long gaming sessions any long
customer_reviews.text: Slim and sleek, its takes up little to no room. Fits both controller perfectly (one being an x Box elite) such a relief when your in the middle of a late night grind and you get that pesky "your batteries are low.) Warning. Jist put your controller on the stand and grab your other one. This is a must have for any Avide gamer.
customer_reviews.author: The dude

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Shorter than my Old Batteries
customer_reviews.text: My old set of Energizer's were only lasting an hour or so after a few years of use (originally lasted 6 at least) so I decided it was time for new ones. When I unboxed the new ones I threw the old ones away which was a HUGE mistake because these new ones are useless. One of them lasts about an hour and the other one only turns on for about 15 seconds at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Recommend you get this one!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase. Arrived as promised without flaw. Packaged well. Works simply and without overheating the controllers. The controllers are not included, in case some wondered from the picture. The instructions were clear, and it took no time at all to get the controllers batteries changed for the charging packs. Seems to charge quickly as well. The red light to green light indicator is better than some of the other charge indicators we have seen.
customer_reviews.author: rcaseytx

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product for any Xbox One Gamer
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, if you own an Xbox one you have excuse not to own one. It comes with a set of rechargeable batteries and the back plates for two controllers as well as the stand. It charges my controller very quickly and looks nice sitting on my side table. Light glows a subtle but easily visible red when charging and green when charge is complete. I only have one controller and was hoping I could charge a battery pack while using the other pack but that isn't possible, can only charge the batteries when in the controller, but I have never ran out of charge when using the provided batteries. Excellent product at excellent price. Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.author: K.P. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Green Charged Light Now Dark After Only a Few Days of Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this charging station for my husband as a Christmas gift. He's had i set up for just a few days and it has charged both controllers. But now the green light that indicates that one of the units is charged has gone completely black. There is no way of knowing if a unit is fully charged or not. Now we will have to send it back to amazon and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Appleseed

customer_reviews.title: Works smooth and  as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This charger and battery packs work great. The controllers fit on the cradle snugly and don't fall off. The charger does not take very long to charge the controller with the battery pack inserted. The best thing is, no more batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: (Bought two of these) Started out mostly fine, but gradually got to be totally annoying
customer_reviews.text: (Bought two of these) Started out mostly fine, but gradually got to be totally annoying: the slightest bump, even loud noises in adjoining rooms will disengage the controller from the charging cradle. Sometimes they will even disengage for no apparent reason randomly, and the controller will not be charged the next time we use the Xbox. Drives my whole family up the wall. You need reflexes like a ninja to place the controllers in the dock...just...right...for them to engage. I recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great charging stand
customer_reviews.text: My only criticism is that the battery doesn't last as long as using actual AAs, but that isn't going to stop me from using the charging stand and saving money from not having to buy batteries. I'd say I get about 3 days of Netflix/Hulu/YouTube/Movie use out of the batteries, and maybe 2 days of Forza Horizon 3, Tomb Raider, and Fallout 4. The stand is rather small so it's easy to put somewhere and not have to move it.
customer_reviews.author: BossKnight

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Aesthetic and Long Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Solid charging station. The batteries that came with my old one finally went out. For the price I decided to buy a whole new charging station with battery packs. I decided on this one based on the aesthetic but so far the battery life seems great. Played for 8 hours straight without needing to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Aliby

customer_reviews.title: but it does charge like its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The controllers have to be in just the right position to make contact with the connectors to charge. It gets old having to fiddle with finding the right position, but it does charge like its supposed to. So far (about 1 month) the batteries have been working well,
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Holds 2 controllers solidly while charging. The only issue is small. Sometimes you have to work to make sure the controller is seated properly so that it makes a good connection to charge. There is a light that will come on to indicate that it is seated properly, though, so it’s easy to do. The charge lasts a long time, & not ever having to change out batteries is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason
